intro: Rubus acutiformis, commonly known as the sharp-leaved blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and thickets. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other Rubus species.
